titleStmt.title: Rudolph Mackwitz to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2306

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
RUDOLPH MACKWITZ,
Attorney and Counsellor at Law,
NOTARY PUBLIC, COMMISSIONER of DEEDS,
and GENERAL AGENT.
St. Louis. Mo November 7th 1865
To his Excellency the Governor
of the State of Kentucky
Frankfort Ky

The undersigned respectfully states that his Commission as Commissioner of Deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky within the State of Missouri will expire November 29th 1865 and he respectfully prays Your Excellency may reappoint him as such Commissioner -- promising that he will execute and fulfill the duties of said office as conscientiously as heretofore and to the best ability according to law

Very Respectfully
Your obedient servant
R Mackwitz
